Lack of credible sources: The expert's verdict mentions that there is no record of the quote being uttered by Hillary Clinton in any major publication or news account. This lack of credible sources casts doubt on the authenticity of the claim.
Origin from a Tumblr page: The quote first appeared on a Tumblr page dedicated to generating fake Hillary Clinton quotes. This raises suspicions about the reliability and credibility of the source.
Unverified claims by the Tumblr page: The expert's verdict states that the Tumblr page claims to have "100% verified" links, but upon review, all the memes posted on the page were found to be completely fictional. This lack of verification undermines the credibility of the claim.
Similarity to a fabricated quote attribu: The expert's verdict suggests that the fabricated quotation about Democratic voters being "stupid" and "easy to manipulate" may have been inspired by a similar false statement attributed to Donald Trump. This similarity raises concerns about the authenticity of the claim and suggests a potential pattern of spreading false quotes.
